meanings.definition: A person or thing that attracts or is capable of attracting something.
meanings.sent1: The popular singer was one of the main attractors at the music festival.
meanings.sent2: The magnet's strong pull made it a powerful attractor for metal objects.
meanings.sent3: The shiny disco ball was the attractor of all eyes on the dance floor.
meanings.sent4: Her infectious laughter acted as an attractor, drawing everyone to her positive energy.
meanings.sent5: The sweet smell of freshly baked cookies served as a delightful attractor for customers entering the bakery.

meanings.definition: A mathematical set or point towards which a dynamical system evolves over time.
meanings.sent1: In chaos theory, the attractors determine the long-term behavior of the system.
meanings.sent2: The attractors in the model represent the stable states the system can reach.
meanings.sent3: The attractors in the equation seemed to have a mind of their own, pulling the values towards them.
meanings.sent4: The attractors acted like magnets, guiding the system towards specific outcomes.
meanings.sent5: The attractors in the simulation were like invisible hands shaping the system's trajectory.

meanings.definition: A feature or characteristic that draws attention or interest.
meanings.sent1: The unique design of the building was a major attractor for tourists visiting the city.
meanings.sent2: The bright colors of the advertisement served as an attractor for potential customers.
meanings.sent3: The quirky mascot of the team became the unexpected attractor of media attention.
meanings.sent4: Her charming personality was the main attractor that drew people towards her.
meanings.sent5: The rare gemstone's sparkle acted as a natural attractor, captivating all who saw it.
